p: Meningococcal disease may present as meningococcal meningitis, meningococcal meningitis with meningococcemia, and isolated meningococcemia. It is a disease caused by the bacterium Neisseria meningitidis. Even though there are 12 bacterial serotypes, invasive meningococcal disease is associated with six, classified based on the polysaccharide capsule (A, B, C, W-135, X, Y) [ 1]. The bacterium colonizes the nasopharynx of asymptomatic carriers up to about 5â€“10 % of the population, being transmitted from person to person by respiratory secretions [ 2].
